description.content: Has Rampart. Reduce all damage to self and allies in orthogonal spaces by 2, as if by armor.
Can move diagonally, and dash moves full speed.
Immune to damage from missed attacks, area effects and successful saves.
Movement ignores rampart, interrupts, and vigilance.
Gains resistance against all abilities from characters that are outside of range 2 from them (Cover halves ranged damage).
Takes 1 turn for each player character.
This character doesn’t trigger slay effects, is removed when defeated, and is immune to all statuses.
Has defiance.
Has regeneration.
Has phasing.
Has flying.
Has sturdy.
To make a Folk foe, use basic foes and apply the Kin template and Great Culture trait of your choice.
Chroniclers can take slow turns like players. If they choose to take a slow turn, they gain 3 vigor.
Once a combat, when the Churner would roll a random d6 as part of an ability, they can choose which number to roll.
Aura 1. The Guide and allies in the aura are immune to movement penalties from terrain and elevation.
If the Guard ends any turn without attacking, they gain Sturdy and Vigilance +1.
If an attack misses the Aeronaut, they may deal 2 damage to the attacker, then fly 2.
When the Sailor sacrifices any amount, they gain 3 vigor after the triggering ability resolves.
Has evasion unless suffering from a status.

The Rider starts combat riding a trained monster, and can also mount it as an action or by spending its standard move. While riding, the rider shares space with the monster and moves when it moves, becoming unstoppable while moving this way. If the two are separated, this effect ends until the monster is remounted.
sm_leggio_monsterrider_tamemonster
Moving up terrain costs no movement. Can phase through characters and doing so costs a maximum of 1 movement.
When a character collides from the pole fighter’s moves, they are slashed. Slashed characters take fray damage instead.
+1 boon on attacks and saves for every adjacent ally.
While the Immortalist is on the battlefield and not defeated, all relict’s Rise Again trait activates on a 3+.
Gains phasing, and has resistance unless adjacent to a foe.
Deals +2 damage with all abilities against bloodied foes.
If this character attacks the same character as last turn, it deals bonus damage and gains +1 boon. This effect stacks.
This character becomes a height 1 object when defeated instead of a character, and cannot be returned to the battlefield.
This character becomes a 2x2 series of height 1 objects when defeated instead of a character, and cannot be returned to the battlefield.
Can share space with other characters. Foes treat the space as difficult terrain, are slashed+ while inside, and have cover from the outside, but are otherwise targetable normally.

Any foes that start their turn inside its space take fray damage. Foes that attempt to leave this character’s space by any means on their turn must save or become unable to exit it until the end of the current turn.
After taking damage that bloodies it, becomes intangible until the start of its next turn as it wriggles out of its flesh.
For the rest of combat, gains phasing and flying.
Attacks never miss the Immortal (turn any miss into a hit).
While Immortal is undefeated, it has Aura 2. Relict without this trait inside cannot be reduced past 1 HP.

subcontent.content: When defeated, summon 4
fj_relict_mob_husk
in or adjacent to its space.
At the start of its turn, the Grave summons a
fj_relict_mob_husk
in a free adjacent space. When the Grave is bloodied, it summons 2
fj_relict_mob_husk
instead.

description.content: When defiance activates, roll a d6. On a 3+, this character immediately regains defiance. Divine damage bypasses this trait.
Gains phasing, flying, and speed 6.
At the start of the round, the lich begins incanting. It chooses a foe, who gains aura 2, and becomes immune to being shoved by the lich’s abilities.

Every other part of the battlefield begins to shift with crawling darkness. At the end of the round, the battlefield erupts. All foes not in the safe zone marked by the aura must sacrifice 50% of their maximum hp. If any of a character’s soul fragments are not in the safe zone, they must additionally sacrifice 25% of their max hp per soul fragment caught outside the area.

This Legend is made up of three powerful undead lords. Each is a unique character and tracks statuses and effects separately, but all three share the same health pool and become bloodied when their total health is at 50%. When educed to 0 hp, all three are defeated simultaneously.

When this legend takes a turn, it acts with one of the three Lords. It cannot take another turn with a Lord in a round until all three have acted. However, abilities with an Imperium effect grant the two lords who are not currently acting an additional effect.
At the start of round three, and every third round thereafter, all three Lords use their Round actions simultaneously.
Reduce all damage taken by 2.
Spaces adjacent to you have Rampart.
After they attack, the Vessel knight marks their target, granting a stack of malice.

subcontent.content: Malice stacks indefinitely and can mark any number of characters.
At the end of their turn, a character sacrifices 3 for every stack of Malice they have.
If a character suffering from Malice doesn’t attack during their turn, at the end of their turn, they reduce their stacks of Malice by 2 before sacrificing, which could clear them.
It can also be cleared by anything that clears a mark, but doing so only clears one at a time.

description.content: Relict are a legion of mindless husks, cursed with an undying existence. This gives all relict except Legends the following traits:

This character has a chance to rise again when defeated. Roll 1d6 at the start of each round that this character is defeated. On a 5+, this character gets back up at 25% hp, returning it from defeated, and can take a turn normally this round.
If defeated again, this character disintegrates and is removed from the battlefield. If all characters with this trait are defeated, it deactivates.

subcontent.content: Add a
fj_relict_mob_husk
mob to a fight. This does not take up points in the encounter.

description.content: Death March affects all allies in range 3.
Deals bonus damage and has evasion unless there’s two or more adjacent characters.
When this character would be defeated, instead becomes intangible until the end of its next turn, then removes itself from the battlefield. It cannot return.
While adjacent to an object, has resistance.

When defeated, explodes in a large blast area effect explosion centered on the wraith. Characters inside take piercing fray damage, twice, as an area effect. The wraith is then removed from the battlefield. Create a pit in the area it vacated.

subcontent.content: Aura 1.
fj_relict_mob_husk
are immune to all damage while in the aura.

description.content: Add to this mob by 1 at the start of every round, placing a new member anywhere on the battlefield not adjacent to a foe.
This mob is defeated if all of its allies is defeated, and disintegrates.
Gain +1 action when bloodied.
When half its members are remaining or less, this pack gains +1 action.
The Harpy has aura 2. Foes in the aura gain +1 curse on saves and do not save against statuses at the end of their turn. The aura increases to aura 3 when the Harpy is bloodied.
The Barghest can teleport 5 instead of taking a standard move.
Can share space with other characters and objects. Any foes that end their turn inside its space take fray damage. Does not provide obstruction, but characters treat its space as difficult terrain.
When bloodied, becomes intangible until the end of its next turn.
The Bonabra starts combat asleep.

If the Bonabra is damaged at all by a foe’s ability, it wakes up and flies into an unstoppable rage. It also wakes up at the start of round 4. If combat ends before then, or all its allies are defeated before then, the Bonabra remains asleep and is instantly defeated.
This beast has aura 1. Foes in the aura take +1 curse on attacks and saves.
The Baggoth blocks line of sight and provides cover as though it was a height 3 object.
Foes that end their turn adjacent to the Baggoth take 3 damage and are slashed.
This beast ignores height movement penalties. When it ends any movement on a lower elevation than it started, it gains flying for the duration of that movement.
Aura 1. Allies inside the aura have evasion and foes are blinded+. Becomes aura 2 when bloodied.
The Burrower is at home in the earth, granting it the following beneifts:

subcontent.content: Has phasing.
While inside a pit, has evasion.
Ambush creates a pit under its target, hit or miss.

description.content: While the Ape or its host is bloodied, it has aura 2. Foes in the aura are sealed+, take bonus damage, and take 2 piercing damage if they end their turn there.
While the fish or its host are bloodied, the fish and its host have evasion. Any foe that starts or ends its turn adjacent to the host while the barrier is active is shoved 1 away from it.
Collide:

subcontent.content: Foe is stunned.

description.content: While the Tick or its host are bloodied, it has aura 2. Attacks from outside the aura against characters in the aura gain +1 curse and deal half damage.
When the Flower or its host take damage, all adjacent foes take 1 piercing damage. This effect can trigger any number of times a round, and does not break pacified.
When defeated, explodes in a small blast area effect centered on it. Characters inside are shoved 1 away from the origin space and must save or take [D]+fray, or fray on a successful save.
Can phase through terrain and characters.
At the start of combat, creates two terrain effects, medium blast areas of cursed deep water.
Terrain Effect:

subcontent.content: The center space is a pit, and all other spaces are difficult terrain. None can be placed within range 3 of each other.

description.content: Can move through all spaces of its own deep water areas normally, and has evasion in those areas.
The Fisher is intangible unless there’s a foe adjacent to its Lure
Has evasion while adjacent to an object. In addition, if this beast ends its turn adjacent to an object, it gains stealth.
Some of the Basilisk’s abilities inflict petrification, which has the following effects:

subcontent.content: When a character gains petrification, give them a token.

If a character reaches 3+ tokens, at the end of their turn, discard all petrification tokens, then they are defeated, removed from the battlefield, and replaced by a height 1 lifelike statue object with 10 hp. Return them to the battlefield and rescue them when the statue is destroyed. They can take a turn as normal starting with next round.
A character can get rid of 1 petrification token if at the end of their turn if they have not attacked, and 1 petrification token if they have not moved.

description.content: The Chimaera has three heads, chosen or rolled for from the list of choices, each unique.

subcontent.content: Each head has 1/3 of the Chimaera’s total hp, rounded up.

When dealing damage to the Chimaera, a character must choose which head they are damaging, and can only target one head at once. Heads that are reduced to 0 hp are defeated. Damage that ‘spills over’ on one head is lost.
Each head has unique set of abilities. Abilities become more powerful the less heads there are.
Statuses, marks, or other effects only affect the currently acting head.

description.content: Each time the Chimaera takes a turn, it takes a turn with only one of its heads. A different head must act from the last head that acted, unless there is only one head left. The Chimaera is only defeated when all three heads are defeated.
tf_beast_chimera_choice_lion_lionspride
af_beast_chimera_lion_savagebite
af_beast_chimera_lion_roar
While the Lion is undefeated, reduces damage to all other heads by 2, as if from Armor.
tf_beast_chimera_choice_bull_bullsfortitude
af_beast_chimera_bull_headbutt
af_beast_chimera_bull_rampantgalloping
While the Bull is undefeated, the Chimaera is immune to being shoved.
tf_beast_chimera_choice_serpent_serpentsguile
af_beast_chimera_serpent_numbingbite
af_beast_chimera_serpent_poisonbliss
While the Serpent is alive and undefeated, bloodied foes deal only half damage to the Chimaera.
tf_beast_chimera_choice_crocodile_crocodilessavagery
af_beast_chimera_crocodile_openwound
af_beast_chimera_crocodile_deathroll
While the Crocodile is undefeated, the Chimaera’s attacks can critical hit (+[D]).
tf_beast_chimera_choice_toad_toadsrepulsion
af_beast_chimera_toad_tongue
af_beast_chimera_toad_swallowwhole
While the Toad head is alive, all heads have counter.
tf_beast_chimera_choice_baboon_baboonsmalice
af_beast_chimera_baboon_deepbreath
af_beast_chimera_baboon_pyroclast
While the Baboon head is undefeated, all the Chimaera’s damage is piercing.
tf_beast_chimera_choice_wolf_wolfsbrutality
af_beast_chimera_wolf_savageclaw
af_beast_chimera_wolf_shadowbreath
While the Wolf head is undefeated, the Chimaera gains stealth if it ends its turn with no foes adjacent.
af_beast_chimera_goat_goatswisdom
af_beast_chimera_goat_crossbolt
af_beast_chimera_goat_primalmeteor
tf_beast_chimera_choice_chicken_chickensspite
af_beast_chimera_chicken_peck
af_beast_chimera_chicken_returntoegg
While the Chicken head is undefeated, all attacks against the Chimaera take +1 curse.
tf_beast_chimera_choice_bear_bearsvitality
af_beast_chimera_bear_icypath
af_beast_chimera_bear_coldfeet
While the Bear is undefeated, the Chimaera’s Juggernaut trait triggers twice at the start of the round.
af_beast_apex_toxiccloud
af_beast_apex_harden
af_beast_apex_sanguinebarb
af_beast_apex_primalcharge
af_beast_apex_stonetoss
tf_beast_apex_earthglide
af_beast_apex_seismicgeyser
tf_beast_apex_blendin
af_beast_apex_primalambush
tf_beast_apex_winged
af_beast_apex_talonsnatch
af_beast_apex_tailsweep
af_beast_apex_carrionstash
af_beast_apex_shriek
af_beast_apex_primalelements
The Gigantapede occupies an arc 6 space instead of a normal space for its size.

Only its first and last space (the head and the tail) are attackable or can be used to make attacks or abilities, but its entire body causes obstruction and engagement. Keep track of which is the head, and which is the tail.
Only one space can be hit if both are included in the area of an attack or ability (attacker chooses which).
When it moves, move its head, then rearrange its body in any valid configuration.
The Worm has the following abilities:

subcontent.content: Immune to blinded.
May use its standard move to teleport from the area of any pit to any other pit in range 4
Has resistance while inside a pit.

description.content: The Apex has three unique abilities, depending on what type of beast it is. Choose or roll for them. The third ability only becomes usable during its second phase.

Before the fight, the GM places three small blast difficult terrain areas on the map. None can be placed in range 2 of each other. Each area is a hunting ground. The Apex gains +1 boon on attacks and deals bonus damage to characters in hunting grounds.
A foe that ends their turn inside any space of a hunting ground can attempt to make a ploy against the Apex by using the natural environment, as long as the Apex is in range 3.

subcontent.content: Making a ploy is a free action that ends a character’s turn.
That player describes to the GM the impressive stunt they pull against the Apex, then rolls 1d6 and hands the die to the GM.

While the Apex has the die, it takes bonus damage and one of its Might of the Wild abilities is disabled, has no effect, and cannot be used, chosen by the player. It reduces the die by 1 at the end of each of its turns. When a die would be reduced to 0, discard it.
Each hunting ground can only be used once to disable the Apex.
The Apex can keep multiple dice at once (track which ability they are disabling) and the bonus damage effect from them stacks.

description.content: The Bonabra cannot act or move outside of its turn, and only takes one action on its turn.
The Bonabra gains 3 actions, can use its Unstoppable Rage abilities, and can only use those abilities, dash, interact, and standard move.
The Bonabra blocks line of sight and can be used as cover as though it was a height 3 object.
Has armor 10.
When taking damage more than its armor total, loses all armor, becomes stunned, and all attacks against it deal bonus damage. These effects last until the end of its next turn.
The shark has evasion and phasing. The shark cannot move through objects. If the shark collides with an object, it is stunned and loses this trait until the end of its next turn.
At the start of its turn, the land shark shoves itself as far as possible towards the closest foe, with each space of its movement moving closer to that foe.
If the closest foe is standing on an object, as soon as the shark would move onto the object’s space, it collides with it and stops moving.
Gains immobile.
Gains counter.
Gains unstoppable.
All of the beast's abilities gain:
Collide:

subcontent.content: Foes are weakened. Weakened foes instead take 2 damage and the beast gains 2 vigor.

description.content: When defeated, this character curls up and becomes a height 1 boulder object.
If this beast ends its turn adjacent to an object or or inside difficult or dangerous terrain, it gains stealth.

Starts combat sharing the same space as another ally the same size or larger. While latched on, can’t move, but instead moves with its host. Being moved out of its host’s space end this effect. If the Symbiote would be shoved, teleported, or removed from the battlefield, it can pass a save to avoid the effect and become immune to these effects until the end of the current turn. Can latch on to a new adjacent allied character with 1 action or its standard move ability.

Starts combat sharing the same space as another ally the same size or larger. While latched on, can’t move, but instead moves with its host. Being moved out of its host’s space end this effect. If the Symbiote would be shoved, teleported, or removed from the battlefield, it can pass a save to avoid the effect and become immune to these effects until the end of the current turn. Can latch on to a new adjacent allied character with 1 action or its standard move ability.
Chapter 3:

subcontent.content: If latched on, if Enraged, also grant + 1 action to its host. This stacks with a host’s Enrage.

description.content: Attacks deal 1 piercing damage on hit or miss to all foes in range 2 of the target as an area effect.
Attacks deal 1 piercing damage on hit or miss to all foes in range 2 of the target as an area effect.
Chapter 3:

subcontent.content: At round 3+, Blight Splash triggers three times.

description.content: Many of the Wyrm’s abilities key off a particular map edge, called the Path of Ruin. The GM decides and announces the initial Path of Ruin edge at the beginning of combat, then it moves clockwise at the start of each round.

Many of the Wyrm’s abilities key off a particular map edge, called the Path of Ruin. The GM decides and announces the initial Path of Ruin edge at the beginning of combat, then it moves clockwise at the start of each round.
Phase II:

subcontent.content: In Phase II all Path of Ruin effects activate twice: once directed towards where the Path of Ruin currently is, and then once where it will be next round.

description.content: The wyrm’s divine fire scorches the very soul. When an ability inflicts dragon fire, all of its targets sacrifice 25% of their max hp.
The Apex has Phasing.
If the Apex starts its turn in difficult or dangerous terrain, it gains stealth.
The Apex’s standard move is fly 5, and all its dashes or rushes may be replaced with a fly. This trait deactivates if weakened.

If a Scavenger has 4 or more valuables tokens, they attempt to flee the battlefield, fleeing successfully if they start their turn in an edge space of the battlefield with no hostile characters adjacent.

If fighting scavengers, the GM places valuables tokens on the battlefield equal to the number of players +1. Valuables can be picked up by any character by moving into their space. They don’t provide obstruction, can’t be targeted, and can share space with anything except other valuables tokens.

Characters drop them in adjacent spaces when defeated, or can drop them voluntarily as 1 action. Any character that ends a fight holding two or more valuables tokens gains 1 dust. Valuables tokens left on the battlefield don’t count.

subcontent.content: When the Scavenger uses an ability and either they or their target has one or more valuables tokens, the ability gains more powerful
greed
effects.

description.content: This character always treats bloodied foes as if they have a valuables token.
The first time the Junker is damaged by an attack or ability in a combat, reduce all damage to 0 and summon 1 valuables token in free space in range 2 from them.
Doesn’t pick up valuables tokens. Instead, counts as holding any valuables tokens it is standing on, and has resistance while standing on at least one.
Has resistance while adjacent to two or more foes.
Gains stealth at the start and end of their turn if holding a valuables token.
Attacks that break stealth deal bonus damage and can critical hit (+[D]).
Has evasion against characters holding a valuables token.
Starts with 1 valuables token.
Aura 2. All characters inside count as holding 1 valuables token.
The Blood Broker has Aura 2:
• Foes inside the aura that use an ability must sacrifice 2 after the ability resolves.
• Whenever a character in the area sacrifices, the broker may grant 2 vigor to itself or any ally in the aura.
The first and second time this character is damaged by an ability in a combat, reduce all damage to 0 and summon a valuables token in spaces in range 2 from them.
All remaining Brothers become sturdy and gain The Boot.
af_scavenger_bloodboundband_boots_theboot
One brother can use Grapple once a round.
af_scavenger_bloodboundband_fixer_grapple
All remaining Brothers gain Dripping Blade.
tf_scavenger_bloodboundband_filth_drippingblade
Attacks force the attack target to sacrifice 3 after dealing damage.
All Brothers gain Feline Felicity.
af_scavenger_bloodboundband_cats_felinefelicity
All Brothers gain Great Swindle.
af_scavenger_bloodboundband_sharkie_greatswindle
All Brothers go to speed 5 and gain phasing.
All attacks can critical hit (+[D]).
All Brothers gain Keen Eye, and one brother can use Ricochet Shot once a round.
tf_scavenger_bloodboundband_sharp_keeneye
af_scavenger_bloodboundband_sharp_ricochetshot
One brother can use Spark once a round.
af_scavenger_bloodboundband_fanatic_spark
All Brothers gain Defiance.
All foes are marked by Bounty Hunt
af_scavenger_bloodboundband_monger_bountyhunt
Designate one foe the commanding officer of the imperial detachment. They get a special template.
Special Template: Imperial Officer
Any job
This template stacks with other templates.

subcontent.content: Promotion:
Starts combat with vigor equal to their VIT.
Imperial Command Aura:
Aura 2. Allies in the aura gain +1 boon on attacks.

description.content: At the start of the round, give an orders token to any imperial character. That character automatically activates any exceed effects of their attacks, deals bonus damage, and gains +1 action, but can only take their turn after all other imperials have acted. At the end of the round, discard that token.
When ending their turn with no foes or allies in range 2, gains stealth.
Aura 1. Allies ignore engagement and rampart effects while in the aura, and may dash 1 if they start their turn there.
May rush 2 before making any attack. If the attack triggers exceed, may rush 2 again.
Has evasion against ranged attacks.
At the start of their turn, the Evocatus and all allies may dash 1 in the same direction.
Before combat starts, may move every character to any space up to 2 spaces in any direction from their starting location.

subcontent.content: When fighting demons, at the start of combat, place a
fj_demon_mob_natal
mob, this faction’s special mob, on the map. The mob does not count for the total faction budget.

description.content: Becomes unstoppable if it devours another non-natal demon.
Becomes unstoppable if it devours another non-natal demon.
Chapter 2:

subcontent.content: Engorge also grants bonus damage on all abilities.

description.content: Becomes unstoppable if it devours another non-natal demon.
Chapter 2:

subcontent.content: Engorge also grants bonus damage on all abilities.

description.content: Chapter 3:

subcontent.content: Engorge also increases the demons’ size to 2. Other characters in the demon’s area when its size are increased are removed and placed adjacent to the demon.

description.content: Void Demons can create void rifts, which are 1 space pit terrain effects with the following features:
• Foes inside void rifts are blinded+.
• Demons inside void rifts have evasion and ignore movement penalties when entering or exiting a rift space
• Void demons can treat any two void rifts as adjacent spaces when moving, teleporting when they move between them. However, they can only teleport this way once a turn.
Void Demons can create void rifts, which are 1 space pit terrain effects with the following features:
• Foes inside void rifts are blinded+.
• Demons inside void rifts have evasion and ignore movement penalties when entering or exiting a rift space
• Void demons can treat any two void rifts as adjacent spaces when moving, teleporting when they move between them. However, they can only teleport this way once a turn.
Chapter 2:

subcontent.content: Void Rifts are also dangerous terrain spaces for foes.

description.content: Void Demons can create void rifts, which are 1 space pit terrain effects with the following features:
• Foes inside void rifts are blinded+.
• Demons inside void rifts have evasion and ignore movement penalties when entering or exiting a rift space
• Void demons can treat any two void rifts as adjacent spaces when moving, teleporting when they move between them. However, they can only teleport this way once a turn.
Chapter 2:

subcontent.content: Void Rifts are also dangerous terrain spaces for foes.

description.content: Chapter 3:

subcontent.content: Void Demons gain stealth+ while adjacent to void rifts.

description.content: The Demon has aura 2. Foes in the aura are pacified+ unless adjacent to an ally.
The Demon has aura 2. Foes in the aura are pacified+ unless adjacent to an ally.
Chapter 2:

subcontent.content: Bloodied foes also have +1 curse on attacks and saves inside Aura of Terror.

description.content: The Demon has aura 2. Foes in the aura are pacified+ unless adjacent to an ally.
Chapter 2:

subcontent.content: Bloodied foes also have +1 curse on attacks and saves inside Aura of Terror.

description.content: Chapter 3:

subcontent.content: Bloodied foes must save before entering any space of Aura of Terror during their turn. On a failed save, they cannot move into the aura by any means until the end of their turn.

description.content: Has counter, and grants counter to all adjacent allies. Each time counter triggers on self or adjacent allies, this demon gains 1 vigor.
Characters that collide with the Nail Demon take 4 damage, but no more than once a round.
When the Horn Demon devours another demon or a natal, it uses its prey’s leftover body as a weapon, hurling it at foes.
A foe in range 4 of the demon becomes weakened and takes 4 damage if devour was used, or just 2 damage if devour natal was used.
Gains phasing, and has evasion unless adjacent to a foe.
After being damaged for the first time on any turn, become intangible until the start of the following turn.
Has stealth+ if no other characters are in range 2.
When the demon teleports, it may deal 1 damage to a foe in range 3.
When the demon is destroyed or devoured, it shatters, teleporting all characters in range 2 from it 2 spaces and dazing them.
When defeated, all foes on the battlefield take 2 piercing damage and gain +1 curse on attacks and saves for the rest of the round.

subcontent.content: Whenever this demon loses all vigor, create a
fj_demon_mob_natal
in range 2.
When defeated (not devoured), explodes in a medium blast area effect centered on it. Non-demons in the area take [D]+fray, then summon 2
fj_demon_mob_natal
in free spaces in the area.

description.content: When defeated, all foes on the battlefield take 2 piercing damage and gain +1 curse on attacks and saves for the rest of the round.
At the start of round 4, this demon explodes, destroying the demon and dealing [D] +fray piercing damage as an area effect to all nondemon characters on the battlefield.
When not bloodied, gain resistance to all abilities from adjacent spaces. However, abilities used against them from range 2 or greater gain pierce and ignore resistance.
When bloodied, gain resistance to damage from any ability not from adjacent spaces. However, all abilities used against them from adjacent spaces gain pierce and ignore resistance.
Phasing and can share space with other characters. Characters that end their turn in its space take fray damage.

At the start of any turn that it is bloodied, the Ooze creates an ooze duplicate in an adjacent space. The duplicate is a new character that is an exact copy of the Ooze at the time this split happens, except without this trait. It may act starting next round. An ooze can create multiple copies of itself this way in a fight.
Ignores engagement from other character, and spends no additional movement moving up or down terrain.
In any battle with the Mimic, place 5 decoys on the battlefield at the start of the battle. Unlike other summons, they lack the intangible trait and can be destroyed.
sm_demon_decoy
This demon’s huge bell is so heavy it can only attack once a round.
This demon’s speed is 15. However, the demon must move in the same direction for each ability it uses, and can only move in straight lines.
Immune to blinded.
Immune to blinded. Simply grows more eyes.
If no foe is in line of sight of the Pale Man at the start of its turn, it spends its entire turn shrieking instead of using abilities.
All foes take [D]+fray piercing damage and are stunned.

At the start of round 1, 3, and 5, the Maze demon creates a special terrain effect of Dissolving Reality anywhere on the battlefield, a medium blast zone. The zone is dangerous terrain to characters other than Demons.

Can share space with other characters and objects. Any foes that end their turn inside its space take 2 damage. Does not provide obstruction, but characters treat its space as difficult terrain. Area effects this character creates can overlap its space, and it is immune to damage and effects from its own attacks.
When the Demon hits with an attack or uses certain abilities, it summons a crawling mass of loose limbs in a free space in range 3 of its location.
sm_demon_crawlingmass
The violence demon can stack any number of marks on foes.
Many actions from this legend summon a blade of agony, an incredibly sharp, bonelike demon blade. Blades can be summoned in range 3 from the demon.
sm_demon_bladeofagony

Critically hitting the demon earns its regard until the end of the round, giving the demon hatred+ of that character for the duration. This effect can switch targets if the demon is critically hit again.

At the start of combat, or as a round action, the Majesty Demon summons until it has the following set of summons active: The Sycophant, the Scepter Bearer, the Shrouded Lady, the Maiden, and one Flagellant Knight per character.

All summons are demons that must be placed within range 2 of a player character or the Majesty Demon and cannot be placed within range 2 of each other. Unlike other summons, some can be attacked and take damage, and are removed when defeated.

The Majesty demon cannot directly target its summons with attacks and effects unless specified. When the Majesty Demon re-summons one of these special summons, it takes damage equal to twice their maximum hp, which cannot be reduced in any way.
sm_majestydemon_sycophant
sm_majestydemon_scepterbearer
sm_majestydemon_shroudedlady
sm_majestydemon_maiden
sm_majestydemon_flagellantknight
The demon deals +1 base damage with its amorphous trait and all its abilities per crawling mass it is sharing space with.
At the start of each round in any combat featuring lowlanders, all nonlowlander characters sacrifice 2 hp.
Lowlanders ignore movement and height disadvantage from pits.
At the start of any round, the GM can spring a lowlander trap in any unoccupied space not adjacent to a player character, with the following features:
• The trap is a pit.
• When activated, a foe in range 2 of the trap must save or be shoved until inside the trap.
• Foes that end their turn inside the pit take 3 piercing damage.
• All traps can be disarmed by a character taking the interact action adjacent, removing it.
All Jotunn have the Elite type if they don’t already have it. They’re worth 2 points in an encounter budget and take 2 turns. Double HP if upgrading from a normal foe.
Increase size to 2 if not already 2.

When defeated, roll 1d6 and assign a compass direction (1 - none, 2- N, 3-E, 4-S, 5-W, 6- GM choice). The Jotunn falls into a medium blast area placed adjacent to its space in that direction. Size 1 characters inside must save or take 6 damage, or 3 on a successful save. Move all characters out of the area into the closest available space and place the defeated Jotunn there. They count as a 2x2 height 1 object while defeated.
You can arm a Jotunn with Titansteel weaponry. This increases a Jotunn’s encounter budget cost by +1. If you do, they have 50% more hp and take one extra turn a round.
The Rider gains a massive Titansteed, granting it the following benefits:

subcontent.content: Increase the Rider’s speed to 5.
The Rider gains flying.
The Rider may break up any of its movement with actions.

description.content: Hobs are immune to difficult terrain.
Like player characters, Hobs have charge abilities and can choose to take a slow turn whenever they would take a regular turn.

subcontent.content: Any fight with Hobs may include a
fj_hob_mob_sprigg
mob.

description.content: Spriggs are intangible and don’t cause engagement or obstruction. Characters can’t collide with them and can share their space. They disappear when combat ends, or all other non-sprigg allies have been defeated.
Gains phasing.
Aura 1. Allies in the aura can use the charged effects of abilities even on normal turns.
Gain sturdy.
Can share space with other characters. Any characters that start their turn inside its space take fray damage.
Saves at the start and the end of its turn to end conditions or other effects.
While bloody, gain +1 action and become unstoppable.
The grub gains stealth if they start or end their turn in a pit and can use 2 spaces of movement to teleport from any pit space to any other free pit space.
Resistant to damage from adjacent spaces.
There can only ever be one Life Hunter on the battlefield.
While bloody, gain +1 action.
Has resistance unless suffering from a status.
Has evasion while inside difficult or dangerous terrain, and ignores the effects of difficult or dangerous terrain.
Has evasion unless suffering from a status.
While in stealth, has evasion and phasing.
Has evasion while bloodied.
Aura 2. Allies in the aura have +1 boon on attacks.
Aura 1. The abjurer and allies in the area have dodge.
When defeated, cures all allies in range 2.
Has resistance when adjacent to an object or inside a pit.
Immune to damage from terrain and terrain effects.
Aura 2. At the start of the scion’s turn, all allies in the aura gain vigor 3
Attacks gain +1 boon and can critically hit (+[D])
Attacks gain +1 boon and can critically hit (+[D]) against foes with no allies adjacent.
The Nocturnal has aura 2. It has evasion and gains stealth if there are no other characters in the aura.

subcontent.content: The Master starts combat with a unique .
fj_general_mob_minions
mob. Minions can be placed anywhere not in range 2 of a player.

description.content: When this phase triggers, remove the Razer from the battlefield, then place them in the center of the battlefield, or as close as possible.
The Razer is immobile during this phase but its abilities have no maximum range. All characters not in cover from the Razer take 4 piercing damage at the end of their turn.
